intro: Heliophila subulata subsp. longipila, commonly known as the long-pilose heliophila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hair-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
